Babies

Just as Winged Migration followed the flights of birds around the globe without the overlay of human narration, French director Balmès is a silent observer to the first year of life of four babies growing up in Mongolia, Namibia, Japan, and California. The cute factor aside, Thomas Balmès' film is a fascinating witness to the differences - and similarities - of child-rearing in environments as wildly varying as a Tokyo high-rise (Mari), and a yurt on the plains of Mongolia (Bayarjargal). Watching the four infants as they learn to walk, talk, and negotiate their own way in the universe is a simple marvel.

"Babies just might restore your faith in our perplexing, peculiar and stubbornly lovable species." -A. O. Scott, Critic's Pick, New York Times. 79 min.

(France, 2010) Directed and photographed by Thomas Balmès; adapted by Mr. Balmès from an original idea by Alain Chabat. With: Hattie, Ponijao, Bayarjargal and Mari.
